intro: Thymelaea pubescens, commonly known as the velvet broom. It is a flowering plant belonging to the Rutaceae family, characterized by its dense, woolly foliage and yellow flowers. Native to southern Africa, it thrives in rocky and sandy soils, often growing in coastal and mountainous regions. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically visited by pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its unique appearance and adaptability make it a notable species in its native habitat.
